Reviews.Title: “Great location but basic”
Reviews.Author: NabaRD
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on TA reviews - so made sure i asked for a large room!! The room was lovely and as per previous reviews, the staff are very helpful. We found hotel very quiet although the street can get a bit noisy at night! Breakfast I found to be basic- standard cold buffet but the crepes are excellent so do ask for those - they wont be on the table. A couple of things to note if you do decide to book here- there are no lifts so you will have a number of stairs to climb. There is no bar or restaurant in this hotel unlike others on the street. There is no foyer to hang out in, although there is a little garden/smoking area. Ladies bring your own hairdryer/iron! They only do an "ironing service" and will not give you an iron. Hairdryers are the zephyr like little ones you find in hotel bathrooms that barely move your hair - be warned!! There is a great little corner shop straight across the road that sells everything from bottled water to deoderant and all at good prices. The hotel also has free wifi which was an excellent plus for us. The location of this hotel is unbeatable as you are literally in the shadow of the blue mosque but just bear in mind that it may not have the little luxuries etc that you might want on your trip away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel on great location”
Reviews.Author: DjurdjicaO
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Darussaade for four nights in April 2012, as short break on my way back from business trip. Rate included a transportation from Ataturk airport. On my way back, I booked shuttle bus (for 5 Eur) that stops directly at hotel. My room (201) was very small, but very clean and otherwise comfortable. I paid total 356 Eur for 4 nights with breakfast in a single room. Breakfast was great, with selection of cheese and home made pastries and cakes. All the staff in Darussade are great (especially guy at the reception desk). Every day they made me a (complimentary) coffee in the afternoon. Location of hotel is really great, in few minutes from Sultanahment - Blue Mosque and Hagha Sophia. I enjoyed this trip and recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gutv
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good location, very clean. the staff was extremely helpful without getting on your way. The room was small but it did not bother us. We did get some noise, I don't think it can be avoided in this city. Overall I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location for Old city”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler031
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel in the perfect location for sights in Sultanahmet (Old City) Good value for money, clean, spacious and very friendly staff. We will certainly use it again when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: atramitram
Reviews.Content: very good, polite, friendly staff. In the center of the old city. Romantic small rooms, but also larger deluxe rooms. Very clean, comfortable beds. Excellent turkish breakfast. We arrived early in the morning and we had a free breakfast and got also our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Etypejag
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel came as a recommendation from a colleague of my son. It is everything that you would want for a short stay in Istanbul, a clean and tidy hotel with very friendly staff, it has a great 'all you can eat' breakfast buffet that is varied to suit both local and European tastes. My only criticism of this Hotel was that the room was a little small, however as we were out all day visiting the nearby sites, it was of little consequence. It's location is just amazing, within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and the Topkapi Palace. 100 yards from one of the best streets to eat in Istanbul, several of the restaurants in this street come highly recommended on Trip Advisor. About 10 minutes walk to the Tram that gives you good access to the rest of the city. Overall this is a great little hotel that I would highly recommend and a refreshing change from all the big chain hotels that are so bland and boring.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: offandabout
Reviews.Content: Was SO happy to have a comfortable bed with nice linens. Wish I'd been staying more than one night. Fresh baked pastries at breakfast were a treat. `The staff was amazingly nice. I tried to tip the front desk guy extra, but he told my husband (who came out a few minutes after me) that I had already tipped him (I told him not to say anything). Anyway...it was quiet, very clean, and has a great location. It's one of those places I'm torn about reviewing because I don't want a bunch of people to know about it.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to the Trip”
Reviews.Author: 1Worldwalker
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, the location is great. Even better was the attentive service of the hotel personnel. They were friendly and always available to help. They even found us in the breakfast room (great breakfasts by the way) when Backpackers Travel called to say that the overnight train tickets that we needed were finally available for purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AlgarveAllie
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long weekend in Istanbul and stayed at the Darussaade on the recommendation of a friend. The hotel is so well situated, walking distance to The Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar, and the Cistern. The tram station is close but we were able to walk to Emoninlu and the Spice Bazaar (ferry terminal) without any difficulty too. Hotel staff are very helpful, we had one airport transfer booked with them already which was waiting to meet us from our flight. They arranged the return transfer as well which was punctual and well priced. They booked restaurants for us too Breakfast was excellent, good choice., lovely bread and freshly cooked omelettes Rooms are charming -beds really comfy - the only thing I could fault was that our particular room (102) was right at the foot of the stairs and SO noisy with creaking steps and people talking (loudly!). I always travel with earplugs but even these did not dull all the noise. Our friends stayed on the 1st floor and had no problem, so i would advise steering clear of that room if you can. That said it did not spoil our experience at all Excellent restaurants nearby - recommend the Khorasani near the Cistern and the Teras at the Armada Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in Sultanahmet Area”
Reviews.Author: jbeebe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Darussaade for 5 nights and were quite happy with our experience. We had booked a double room because it was the only option available at the time we booked. When we arrived, the helpful desk clerk upgraded us for free to a delux room on the first floor. This room was really quite amazing. The room was already booked for our final night in Istanbul, so for our final night we had to move into a double room, which was quite a bit smaller and a little run down. It was also at the top if three flights of pretty twisty stairs, but the staff took care of moving our bags for us.If we had been in the smaller room for our entire stay, our review would probably be lower, but as it was, we were quite happy with the room we stayed in for the majority of the trip. As others have noted, the hotel is located within easy walking distance to Sultanahmed Square and is just down the road from a number of dining options. A convenience store is located just across the street, which we found useful for buying bottles of water or snacks for our excursions. There are quite a few stores in the area as well for souvenir shopping, but the immediate area felt laid back and safe. The breakfast spread is truely amazing! Fresh fruit, vegetables, hard-boiled eggs, omelets to order, and home cooked baked goods and home made cheeses. Crepes were made fresh and delivered to the table pretty much as soon as we seated ourselves. The young man waiting tables was eager to serve and quick to offer to refill your coffee or tea. The breakfast buffet was definitely the icing on the cake when it came to this lovely stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, unique hotel, great & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GreenNerdy
Reviews.Content: Staying at Darussaade Hotel was a wonderful experience. It is excellently located within walking distance to everything you'd possibly want to see during a short stay in Istanbul - Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Topkapi Palace, grand bazaar, Basilica Cistern, spice market, etc. if you want to go further, just take a tram from the nearby tram station. There's also grocery stores and restaurants nearby. Hotel room is clean, cozy and nicely decorated. We stayed on the first floor, you can hear noises from cars and people talking outside during daytime, but that doesn't matter to us because we were out most of the time. At night it is actually fine because the hotel is not located on a crowded street. Darussaade's staff are all very helpful and friendly. I made a last minute ground package request and the staff manage to book a tour guide for us (unfortunately the tour guide wasn't very professional, I don't wanna talk about that now). The staff gave us a map, hotel card, and walking directions to tourist attractions upon our arrival. There was some misunderstanding about check-out time, but the staff manage to arrange a relaxation room for us so that we can take a nap before leaving to the airport. Breakfast was simple but nice! Having had buffet breakfast for the past 2 weeks, all we need was some simple and unique Turkish breakfast! Will definitely stay in Darussaade again if I ever come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Friendly Spot In the thick of all thats Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Don C
Reviews.Content: I would give it 5 but my feet are tired of all the hills to get to this hotel, but that seems to be all of Istanbul. If your new to Istanbul bring your best walking shoes, its cobblestones & hills everywhere & you will want to see everywhere. So give it 5 stars. The entire staff, from kitchen to front desk can't be beat. Don C.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in excellent area”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer J
Reviews.Content: Hotel Darussaade is a lovely, pretty, clean hotel in a fabulous area for sightseeing. It is just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and many other historic places. It is also in a very convenient position for the tram, to go to many other interesting places such as the Grand Bazaar and the Dolmabahce Palace. However, it's main attraction is the wonderful staff - they are all very helpful, from the kitchen staff to the people on the desk. Cagatay was particularly helpful, with recommendations for restaurants and help with information about transport etc. I will be going back to Istanbul, for work and pleasure and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Darussaade is a perfect hotel for people who want to be in the middle of the historic part of Istanbul but have a quiet place to rest at night. The rooms our group had were lovely and clean. The beds were comfortable. The breakfast is delicious. The staff could not be nicer or more helpful. They guided us to excellent places to eat and even gave me some shopping advice. It doesn't hurt that the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are so close. I would recommend this place highly to anyone travelling to Istanbul. The hotel pickup was also very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turk164
Reviews.Content: Having stayed twice at the Darussaade hotel I can recommend this boutique hotel to everyone. Location is excellent if you want to visit the hotspots at Sultanahmet. Travel to and from the Ataturk airport can be done by special shuttle bus and costs only 5 euro per person. The shuttle stops at the hotel for pick up. The rooms are very well decorated especially the ones on the ground floor and 1st floor. In the evening one can enjoy the serenity of the neigbourhood and get a good and quiet sleep. From the hotel to the lively Taksim square will cost you approx. 15Tl by taxi. Breakfast variety and quality is excellent and overall staff very professional and friendly. Would recommend to anyone. To mention a downside is the lack of a lift especially if your room is on the top (roof) floor. However going up the staff will assist you with your stuff and I am sure they will help you if needed during check out. Wireless internet is available and free of charge

Reviews.Title: “city break perfect”
Reviews.Author: simon b
Reviews.Content: just the perfect place to base a stay, hotel staff so very hospitable, nothing is too much trouble, rooms beautifully decorated, fantastic breakfast spread, our room a little small and with no real view but the atmosphere, cleanliness and staff made it such a great place to stay, and even though your only a 2 minute walk to a wide choice of restaurants and 5 minutes form the blue mosque, the location was quiet and peaceful. will definately return here again.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at thÄ±s hotel sept.2011”
Reviews.Author: susan h
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s hotel was very comfortable and well sÄ±tuated. The staff Ä±s very kÄ±nd; breakfast was delÄ±cÄ±ous wÄ±th a lot of choÄ±ces. Rooms are cleaned every day. SpecÄ±al mentÄ±on for the comfort of the bed Ä±n the Deluxe room. I apprecÄ±ate to be sÄ±tuated close of blue Mosquee and HagÄ±a SophÄ±a. Staff always help you to fÄ±nd a place or to serve you lÄ±ke a sultan!!!!! I recommend thÄ±s hotel. Susan Henry Montreal Quebec Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great place with convenient access to Istanbul's old city”
Reviews.Author: discosour
Reviews.Content: This place offered great convenience, a very quiet night's rest, and very pleasant staff at a reasonable price. It has a bed & breakfast sort of feel, as it's basically just a converted house. Incidentally, the breakfast was outstanding, with many different options for the discriminating palette. About a 3-4 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmet Square, the underground metro, everything. And pretty quick from Ataturk Airport, only about 30-35 minutes by car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well-located, friendly and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: chumpik
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel during a one-week stay in Istanbul. On arrival, we given a very friendly welcome and told our double room had been upgraded, which was a great start. The room was large, had seven windows looking out over the street and was immaculate (including the bathroom). The aircon worked well, and quietly. There were nice touches such as a kettle with selection of herbal teas. The decor was very grand with lots of gold finish, which might be a bit overpowering in other cities but in Istanbul it seemed to be appropriate. Bedclothes, curtains and other furnishing were all very clean and in good condition. Free wifi worked well (and didn't keep dropping out as in so many other hotels). Small LCD TV had English language channels including BBC World. No noise from neighbouring rooms at all. On returning to Reception we were given, without asking, a very helpful introduction to the local area and recommendations for places to visit, and to eat. Exactly as told, most of Istanbul's biggest sights (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Islamic Art Museum, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern ...) and tramway are within a few minutes walking distance, as are about 100 restaurants (the Turquoise was the best one we found - ask for the roof terrace). Breakfast was brilliant - a wide selection of sweet and savoury items, great coffee, fresh homemade bread, and a cooked breakfast on demand if you wanted it. An attentive waiter was always available, though not looming or rushing us. There was plenty of food too, so you didn't worry about getting to it before other guests! And importantly for lazy guests like us, you could take breakfast from 7.30 until 10.30. The room was very thoroughly cleaned every day - the owners of the hotel are proud of a technology they've invested in for cleaning sheets and it shows: everything was pristine. The only minor downside to our stay was occasional noise from the street - due to the busy, central location, and the fact that we were visiting during Ramadan - but the double glazed windows did a good job of cutting it down. When we mentioned this to our hosts, they immediately offered to move us to another room if it continued to be a problem, which it didn't (and we liked the room so much we didn't want to move anyway). None of the noise was the hotel's fault, of course, and would apply to any other hotel in the area. Although there are many good things about this hotel, the best part was the staff: always courteous, friendly, helpful, professional, and good English speakers. On checkout, we noticed we'd not been charged for some tea we'd taken in the tiny hotel courtyard a few days earlier; when we mentioned this to the hosts they brushed it aside. This kind of detail makes you feel genuinely welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cal_Prof
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights at Drussaade in May. It is located conveniently in Sultanahmet, just a ten or fifteen minute walk from virtually everything in that old quarter of Istanbul. The hotel has the appearance of an old Ottoman house with an overhanging second floor. We had a â€œdeluxe double roomâ€� which was furnished in a somewhat gaudy old Ottoman style. The room was not big but was functional for our needs. The bed was comfortable. There was free Wifi which worked perfectly and a small safe in the closet. The bathroom was small but functional with a decent shower. Breakfast, which was free, had a nice selection of Turkish breads, olives, cheeses, etc. as well as made-to-order omelettes. We paid 124 Euros per night. Omar, who seemed in charge, was very warm in his welcome and, like all of the staff, always eager to please. The only negative is that our room faced the street and sometimes there was street noise. Only one night was it really a problem. On balance we were fairly happy with our stay at the Drussaade

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DPL-OZ
Reviews.Content: What a terrific boutique hotel! We had the room right next to reception and it had a gorgeous sitting room a stair or two up from the bedroom. Small but well set up and very comfy.It was a corner room so people could walk past at night but this did not bother us and it was quiet. The hotel is a blue wooden structure newly renovated and very nice indeed. We love these small boutique unique places to stay as the commercial large chains are boring and predictable. Very well located for all the major city sites within easy walking distance. Travel to and from the airports is an issue so make sure you have this planned organised before you go. There are 2 airports and they are different distances out. We did book a van shared with other travellers back out to the airport on departure and that was far far cheaper than the pre organised taxi transport on the way in. We booked this from outside the Topkapi Pallace and that worked very well!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Bertie32
Reviews.Content: Realy enjoyed our stay at the Darussaade. All the staff are charming and very helpful. Perfect location for all the sights and resturants, excellent buffet breakfast, lovely room with good air con.

Reviews.Title: “Started Ok, Ended Appallingly”
Reviews.Author: Daphne96
Reviews.Content: First time to Istanbul. Hotel in a great, convenient location. Staff professional and helpful when equired. That's the good. Now the bad. Stayed in a downstairs room (102) road side. Noise levels were outrageous, from both outside ( pedestrian path, old floor boards, loud creaking as people walked up the stairs, the rooms above, outside the room, going down to the breakfast room etc...non stop shaking, thumping sounds and aggravation. Worst of all was the strong, rotten, sulphuric smell which emanated from our room and caused our eyes, nose, and throats to burn. The fist night we thought it was something outside, but on our last night, it was so strong and unbearable we called the reception and they had to ( at three in the morning ) evacuate us. The smell was nowhere else, just our room. My husband insisted it was something toxic from the pipes, but the manager disagreed. We were sent to a horrible, dingy, uncompleted hotel, came back the next morning to check out and were actually charged ( half price for that night!!! ) We shouldn't have paid anything, for such a shocking experience. Extremely dissapointed, shall not stay here again, esp... as the Darussaade is not exactly the cheapest hotel either. We may have forgiven them if we were compensated somewhat - but to charge the rates they do, for the inconvenience, the danger of being exposed to potentially toxic fumes and the overall lack of restful sleep, due to the constant noise, is shameful and not anyone's idea of a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel with all you may want”
Reviews.Author: travellerfederico
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Darussaade for 4 days. From the moment we arrived until the moment we leave we had such a nice experince. The kindness of the staff, the cleanness of the room, the marvellous breakfast coupled with the best location. This was our second trip to Istanbul and I must say that, in few years time we will come back to Darussaade. We usually stay at local boutique hotels in order to taste the living style of the locals as well as the beauty of the boutique and specific style. Darussaade is one of the boutique hotels that I can recommend to the ones who are planning to visit Istanbul. The hotel is very well renovated Ottoman house which has a unique architecture that you can easily feel when you enter inside. Especially the kindness of the staff at Darussaade and their effort to make things easier for you are the things that you can not find in anywhere else. All in all very helpful and excellent staff, superb breakfast and the best location in Sultanahmet. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PerthResearcher
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to Istanbul's monuments and places of interest. Elegant boutique hotel and reasonably priced. Impeccable rooms, very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast, large variety of preserves, pastries, breads, all freshly made.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than being on the street!”
Reviews.Author: roamingworld
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on good reviews on Trip advisor, but I deeply regret my choice. I travel to Istanbul every year - I love this city! I always stay in the Sultanahmet area and I am aware that the hotels there are small with no luxuries. I also expect to get some noise because the area is busy and bustling. But what I got at the Darussade was beyond anything I would call normal. Every step made by anyone anywhere in the hotel made my bed shake- literally. And when i got neighbors above my room I could hear their every move, and the noise was multiplied by the wooden structure. In addition, there is an old house which is being disassembled and which is adjacent to one of the walls of the hotel ( which happened to be the wall right behind my head), so from dawn to late at night the hotel is shaking from the construction noise. I can only imagine how bad it will be when the construction begins. And to make things even worse- the hotel is located right on a busy road so the traffic noise is pretty bad as well. I have been out of the room most of the time but one needs to have a few quiet hours to rest- something which turned out to be impossible in the Darussaade. Even having a sound machine at nightndid not help with the constant noise coming either from the guest of the hotel, or from the street. The breakfast is decent, butbthe waiter stopped being polite after he saw that I did not leave him a tip the first morning. The variety of food is limited and worse than the other similar budget hotels in the area. Everyone in the reviews I read was praising the hotel staff, but I will disagree to some extend. One of the guys at the front desk was very nice and helpful, but the other guy even did not return my greetings and was treating me like a second- hand person. The rooms are extremely small ( even smaler than the other 4-5 hotels in that area I have stayed in), there is no space even to leave your suitcase. The only good point for this hotel is that it is either new, or recently renovated, so the bathroom fixtures are nice ( no luxury, but still nice), the furniture is also new but the bed is already too soft. There is free wireless internet at the hotel, but it is really slow- even for e- mail, and sometimes it just stops. So, if you come to Istanbul not intending to sleep or even to have an hour or two rest during the day, do NOT come to Darussaade. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, exceptionally clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rjc_56
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Hotel Darussaade and really enjoyed it. All the staff were incredibly friendly and couldn't do enough to assist. The room was clean with a very comfortable bed. The breakfast was good and one morning when we had to leave very early for a Gallipoli day trip they even opened up the breakfast room at 6.15am so we could eat before we left. The location is very close to the major sites (only a 5 minute from the Blue Mosque) and is well served by lots of nearby restaurants. The free WIFI was also appreciated. I highly recommend the hotel as it represents excellent value for money. Would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Indig0Blue
Reviews.Content: Over the last three years, we have stayed in 9 hotels/B&Bs/villas in 7 cities in Turkey. Our favorite place, by far, is the Darussade hotel. Itâ€™s the only place weâ€™ve stayed two years in a row, and we plan to go back in the future. When we travel to Turkey, we generally spend one night in Istanbul to get over jet lag, then fly to another city for our main vacation, then fly back to Istanbul and stay a few days before we depart--thus we have stayed at the Darussade on four different occasions (and in four different rooms, all of them superb.) Youâ€™ll see from my other reviews that there always seems to be a fatal flaw at other places weâ€™ve stayed in Turkey: a place may be beautiful, but the bathrooms flood, the heat in the room is oppressive and cannot be adjusted, or the management is rude. In one otherwise lovely place, we had to sleep with our heads practically out of the window to avoid a strong petrol odor. The Darussade is the only hotel that not only got everything right, (thus earning the only 5 star review of a hotel in Turkey by me thus far) but then went above and beyond, far surpassing any experience Iâ€™ve had in any hotel in terms of customer service, largely due to the superlative management by Ã–mer ParmaksÄ±z. Specific examples of Ã–merâ€™s extraordinary customer service include: â€¢ The Darussade offers a free airport transfer if one is staying four days or more. Last year we stayed one day and then returned a week later to spend three days, and Ã–mer arranged for us to get the free transfer. In addition, because we booked two rooms--one for us and one for my mother-in-law, Ã–mer offered a second free transfer, which we really appreciated. â€¢ We were able to leave a suitcase full of (expensive) gifts weâ€™d brought from the States for our relatives in Istanbul with Ã–mer, who secured it in the office for when we returned for our second Istanbul stay a week later. This allowed us to travel much more lightly, which was really a blessing. Needless to say, all of our things were untouched and safe. â€¢ When we had our relatives over (a party of 6), the Darussade made them feel quite welcome and brought up tea, coffee, and goodies for a very nominal fee. â€¢ When I spoke to Ã–mer (who speaks flawless English) before our first trip, I explained that my MIL, who lives outside Istanbul, would be coming with us and that she seemed to be concerned about showing up at the hotel before us (our flight was coming in the early evening). He offered to call her--which he did do--and introduce himself and welcome her to the hotel and assure her that her room would be ready whenever she would like to come in the afternoon. She loved getting this call and indeed felt very welcome and reassured. â€¢ On our first trip, when we had concerns about the room my MIL was given (because I had read TripAdvisor reviews warning about noise by the reception), Ã–mer gave my MIL our room and then upgraded us to a room on the top floor with a wonderful water view--for free! â€¢ Ã–mer checks when you plan to leave, so if you have an extra-early departure special arrangements can be made for your breakfast. â€¢ This year, I waited a little too late to book at the Darussade; when I called Ã–mer, there was no room available for the second leg of our trip. Ã–mer offered to help us find a nice, reliable, reasonable place to stay elsewhere. As it turns out, the suite opened up, and Ã–mer offered it to us for only 5 Euro more than a standard room! â€¢ Ã–mer honestly told us that it is much less expensive to get a cab from/to the airport, which is around 40 Turkish Lira opposed to 40 Euro for a transfer arranged by the hotel. â€¢ Ã–mer actually gave us a ride back to the airport--in his own car!--as he was getting off work near the same time we were leaving! Who does all this? Really, I am amazed and grateful. One of the reasons why we go on vacation is to â€œget away from it allâ€�--the stress, the headaches, of normal life. To be met by such kindness, time and time again, just really warms the heart. But thatâ€™s not all! The rest of the staff also deserve a huge heartfelt â€œthank youâ€� for their kindness, their professionalism, and their own superlative customer service! â€¢ When we returned for our last leg of our trip this year, it happened to be on the morning that the President was giving a big speech AND there was a marathon, so that Sultanahmet was closed to ALL traffic! We had taken a cab, who was forced to let us off on a highway with all of our stuff! We made it up a hill dragging our stuff, then caught the tram to the stop by the hotel. We then called the hotel and asked them if there was any way they could help us. Ã–mer was off that day, but the manager of the kitchen met us by the tram stop, took two of our heavy bags, and carried them through the streets. When we were close enough that they could call a car and not get in trouble by police, they did and gave me a ride back to the hotel. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU! â€¢ The man at the front desk then rushed out and carried everything and took care of everything nicely. â€¢ The maid is super sweet and nice and does a really good job. Everything is as CLEAN as can be. â€¢ The young waiter is very nice as well. After the first day, he remembered what I like to drink and would fix it for me while I got my breakfast, then carried everything up to the little outdoor courtyard. â€¢ The pastry chef is PHENONEMAL!!!! I teased her that I hated coming to the Darussade because I always leave a few pounds heavier and itâ€™s all her fault! She bakes the most amazing little apple cookies. The expensive pastry shops around the tram have nothing on her. She also makes wonderful borek and savory â€œsaltâ€� cookies. Really, itâ€™s the customer service by Ã–mer and all the staff that keeps us coming back. But the Darussade also earns high marks in the following areas: â€¢ Location. You canâ€™t beat it. The Blue Mosque, St. Sophia, Topaki Palace, and the tram (which goes to the Covered Market and also to the ferries) are all within super-easy walking distance. There is a ton of restaurants at every price point, cafes, and shops of every kind all around. â€¢ Cleanliness. Absolutely no complaints here. Our rooms have always been immaculate. And my MIL is VERY picky. â€¢ Appearance. Lovely. Fifeteen-foot ceilings (in rooms 204 and 206) with gold ceiling medallions, extravagant crown molding, brass beds! The outside of the hotel is also just as pretty as can be, cleanly whitewashed with window boxes full of flowers. â€¢ Comfort. â€œDeliciousâ€� is the word that comes to mind. The linens are wonderfully crisp. The air conditioning is independently controlled in each room, and quickly adjusts to the temperature you set--a Godsend after a horrible experience at a super expensive â€œluxeâ€� hotel (at the Dedeman, in Konya) that didnâ€™t allow individual climate control. On a less substantial note: the Darussade is one of only two hotels in Turkey that Iâ€™ve encountered that include hair conditioner in their freebie grooming products basket--very convenient if you forget yours. A long review, I know, but our positive experiences with the Darussade have been so plentiful that it takes this much space to hit the high spots that occur to me, although there have been many, many more. Thank you, Ã–mer and the rest of the Darussade staff! Looking forward to seeing you next year!

Reviews.Title: “A nice welcome”
Reviews.Author: Xeres25
Reviews.Content: A nice quiet little hotel with excellent service. The hotel is ver clean and has very helpful staff who can be called on to provide whatever your needs are. I was very impressed with how clean the hotel was and the lovely smell of baking. The hotel has lovely furniture and is very convenient for all the local tourist attractions. The only thing that would improve the service is, an iron in the room would be a nice to have. Finally, the hotel is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little B & B”
Reviews.Author: Sunnys_Day
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and was very pleased. The hotel staff was incredibly attentive and the service was wonderful. The location is perfect on a quiet little street in Sultanahmet and the breakfast each day was very generous with a great selection. The rooms are a bit small but the hotel's charm and the attentive staff more than made up for that. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...again!”
Reviews.Author: vinrouge63
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Darussaade in a superior room. Spotlessly clean throughout, attentive service, friendly staff who made a real effort to ensure our stay was as comfortable as they could make it, great breakfast and a fantastic location right in the heart of Sultanahmet. We stayed here a couple of years ago and the standards of this lovely hotel have remained as high as ever. The superior rooms are worth paying a bit extra for as they do give you more space and a king size bed! The rooms are furnished in traditional style and there has been great attention to detail throughout the hotel. The water pressure in the shower is amazing so be warned! There are lots of decent places to eat within easy walking distance and the tram stop is about a 10 minute walk away so getting around the city is very easy if you decide not to walk everywhere (we always end up walking as there is just so much to explore!). Use the regular ferries to go across to the Asian side and enjoy lunch and a wander around. Remember to show respect when in any mosque - no shorts for men and ladies need to cover their head and shoulders and be dressed discreetly. The city is amazing and the Darussaade is a great base from which to explore it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff; perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_in_PDX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Darussaade for 4 nights in May. Truly, the staff is exceptional. They are available 24/7 and respond immediately to personal requests. Our room was on the top floor (303) with a view of the sea. The bathroom is small and closet space is non-existent, but the room was comfortable and extremely clean. The location is absolutely perfect - walking distance to Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Topkapi Palace, Basillica Cistern and Grand Bazaar. There are good restaurants nearby, including our favorite, Aloran Cafe. A varied breakfast is served each morning, including made to order omelettes. We look forward to returning during our next stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “need something? no bother we will get it for you!”
Reviews.Author: chickenfeathers
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews of other hotels in the area how glad I was to follow the advice of other tripadvisors readers. There is nothing to add to the comments of other recent visitors What stands out is the amazing helpfulness of the manager and his marvellous receptionist. absolutely nothing fazed them. Am pleased to see that the hotel is being enlarged .This hotel deserves to succeed

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Dazzler-TA
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying thanks to ALL the staff at Darussaade - you made our stay perfect. After booking a week in Turkey for the F1 Grand Prix, we needed somewhere to stay close to Sultanahmet, close to transport links and somewhere comfortable. Hotel Darussaade ticks all the boxes, and the service is second to none. We have been lucky enough to stay at some really good hotels, but we have never had such good service from ANY location. We arrived and had an issue with our accommodation. The front desk staff, including the night shift, were all aware of the issue and it was resolved the very next day. This went a long way to ensuring we had a brilliant holiday, and for that I am incredibly grateful. A few notes: 1. the aircon changes to heating at night, and this changeover is controlled by reception. You still have the ability to turn on and off, set the temp and fan, but at night it will blow warm 18c air instead of cold (AC) 18c air. 2. the breakfast is handy, filling, and there is a decent variety for everyone. 3. the walls are a little thin - but this is a Turkish thing, not a Darussaade issue. We visited friends in a hotel down the road and the issue was even worse! I would recommend this to any one who wants a comfortable hotel close to everything with A+ service. To all the staff, thanks once again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, classic Ottoman hotel. Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Michiel61
Reviews.Content: This hotel earns my recommendation easily. I think this is what the Americans would call a 'boutique hotel': small, privately owned, classic architecture, tastefully decorated. What I liked (in random order) - classic, wooden building, tastefully decorated - strategic location (100m from Blue Mosque) - very friendly staff - WiFi Internet access included (nice to send emails and photos from your smartphone) - Breakfast. Special compliments for the hotel's restaurant staff for the choice of (often home made Turkish) food and for the service The room we had was not spacious, but that did not bother my son and me, at all. Note that this renovated classic mansion does not have an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel with genuine Turkish hospitality, strategic location and superb food!”
Reviews.Author: Khairunnisa
Reviews.Content: Darussaade is a small hotel located at the heart of Istanbul tourist district. It has fifteen cosy bedrooms (with en-suite bathrooms) in three floors. The breakfast room and massage room are located on the basement. As it a small hotel, it doesn't have a lift / elevator. But with such small size, who needs an elevator? Our room was located on the second floor, with a view of the cobbled stone street. It was a cozy and exceptionally clean room. It was charmingly decorated with traditional Turkish painting, curtain and wallpaper. The bathroomwas very clean and was up to modern standard. This hotel is so strategic that you will not get hungry while you are there. Just a stone's throw away you'll find a convenience store which sells bottled water, fruits, bread, milk etc. The area is scattered with great restaurants (all of them provide al fresco and indoor dining). Another reason why we chose Darussaade was that it was so close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and traditional bazaars. In short, with all its facility and strategic location, Darussaade is a great bargain! We liked everything about the hotel and its surrounding; including the calling to morning prayer which could be heard clearly from our hotel room. The staff were so friendly, professional and helpful too. We cannot think of anything we didn't like while we were staying there. It has simply been a great holiday experience for our family. Ane whenever we come back ti visit Istanbul again, we will definitely stay in Darussaade again :-).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: NairobiCobra
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor. Great room, very clean and comfortable, excellent location and very warm and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and cozy place”
Reviews.Author: Jakky_P
Reviews.Content: This is a warm and cozy hotel. What we like most about the hotel is the location, within walking distance to the Blue Mosque and other attractions. The room is small but cozy and equipped. We got a room on the third floor, so the view was nice (sea view). The only comment is for the lack of elevator (esp. for the luggages). Nevertheless, you can ask the hotel staff to help you. The staff are very friendly and helpful esp. a staff called Omer. There's a reasonable priced convenient store right opposite of the hotel too. It's definitely a nice place to stay if you want to be closer to main attractions...a nice place to rest after a long day exploring the magnificent Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceminded and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ElisabetNorway
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel you'll wish to come back to! The staff is extremely serviceminded and friendly. The rooms are delicate, and they serve a healty and good breakfast. The hotel is located near by the blue mosque and the topcapi palace as well as plenty of good restaurants. We had a great time in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ali1962son
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time we had booked to go to Istanbul and for various reasons had to cancel. I rang the hotel to book a private transfer, which I would recommend as the queue for taxis at the airport was very long and it was great to be shown to a very nice car and not having to explain where we wanted to go.The hotel were very helpful and emailed me to confirm the transfer straight away. We were really happy with the location and the hotel was charming, tastefully decorated to a very high standard. The staff were so pleasant and helpful with recommendations, nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was a huge feast and set us up for the day. I would love to go back to Istanbul and would definitely stay at the Darussaade again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler031
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and the location is perfect for most sights in the Sultanahmet (old city) area. The Hotel sympathetically renovated (if a little OTT) with very friendly and helpful staff and in a fairly quiet area. Although the walls are a bit thin and you hear the traffic on the stairs it is relatively quiet. Very good value compared to other hotels in the area.Also free Wi-Fi unlike most big hotels who charge by the hour. The hotel is located within walking distance of many good restaurants. I can recommend Mozaik Restaurant, Albura Kathisma (in the same street as the hotel) and of course the fabulous Sarnic Restaurant in the 1600 year old Roman Cistern. We had a problem with the hotel-limo service from the airport (didnâ€™t turn up) so we took a taxi at half the price the limo would have cost. However, they then offered a free service back to the airport. I suggest using the tram service for sightseeing. It is very easy to use and at least you are not ripped off by the taxi drivers. 9 out of 10 are dishonest, if you have to use them make sure you know how much it should cost for the distance you want to travel. Istanbul is the best place to buy Saffron at reasonable prices, but beware of rip-offs, Ebcin Baharat; shop no. 68 in the Egyptian Spice Bazaar is very honest and sells excellent quality at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make this hotel special”
Reviews.Author: BenDebHannifin
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet is perfect location for staying in Istanbul and Darussade Otel is the perfect hotel. Rebuilt into it's original Ottoman style, the hotel had a very homely feel. I think that was because of the staff. They were incredibly friendly and so helpful....they had a gift at making you feel special. The rooms are not massive, but given the style that's not a concern.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: haydar190479
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days. Some of us have been in istanbul before, but this is the best hotel we have stayed in no doubt. The breakfast was great, they had different types of homemade "BÃ¶rek" etc. everyday. The staff had the smile on the face everytime 24/7. The rooms was nice and clean. The receptionists know istanbul well, and they can help you with everything you need. thanks to everybody from we will be back in sept/oct. Hersey icin TesekkÃ¼rler Haydar

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Alecko
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor to Istanbul I've stayed in a range of hotels in and around the Sultanahmet district. We had planned to stay in Darussaade last year, but it was fully booked; however an early spring visit this month offered the opportunity. It was excellent and the service is second to none. Although it is a small hotel, the location is perfect for exploring the historic areas of the old city, and there are plenty of great restaurants and cafes around the area. The accommodation is spotless, it has great bathrooms and there is perfect service. There is free wifi in the rooms, and complimentary tea or coffee served in the lobby on arrival. Breakfast is particularly good, with a wide range of excellent choices on the buffet and hot dishes available on request. We enjoyed our three night stay and would definitely make the same choice again... but early reservation is recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Five star experience at 4 star prices”
Reviews.Author: capote66
Reviews.Content: Recently and beautifully restored Ottoman-style hotel in the heart of Sultanamet. All the staff very tourist-friendly, especially the breakfast waiter. We stayed in room 206, a delux double on the Ist floor. A sumptiously furnished room with all the mod cons. If you want a sea view room, you need to go one floor higher. All in all a terrific hotel well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel that I have ever stayed in all Europe”
Reviews.Author: sinzmu
Reviews.Content: I'm travelling a lot, especially around Europe, both for business and vacation. Darussaade is the best hotel that I have stayed not only in Istanbul, whole around Europe. The rooms are new and very clean, you feel as if you are the first guests. Although the location is downtown in the old city, the building itself is renovated with very nice decoration, and so makes you feel both in new and historical place. Breakfast is cool. Sometimes the friendly stuff makes little surprises like serving some cherry wine which is delicious. A young family is managing the hotel, they take care of each guest very closely; they became our friends in the fist day and were always helpful during our entire trip. If you prefer boutique hotels with best locations, I strongly recommend this one for Ä°stanbul

Reviews.Title: “It is just perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: sultan89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Nice architecture + interior. Its just as if you are at home. The people in the hotel are very friendly and helpful espesially Cagatay. He helped me in every single thing I was planning to do. Even he helped me mark my map with around 30 loctions to visit. Finally, I would like to thank everyone in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully-staffed hotel, well placed for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: PirkkaLahtinen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and well decorated. It is perfectly situated: close enough to sights and restaurants, but away from the bustle. The staff are just fantastic; friendly, helpful and efficient. As a previous reviewer also said, they were great at tracking down missing luggage via the airport and getting it delivered. Also helped with sightseeing advice, ironing... and tea on a chilly day :-) Would definitely return to the Darussaade for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best, most attentive service ever. Tesekkurler”
Reviews.Author: RedDawn999
Reviews.Content: A somewhat belated review. Stayed at Darussaade with extended family in late October occupying more than half of their rooms for a week. I have to say we have never stayed in a more friendly, homely hotel than this before anywhere in the world. The wonderful staff, especially the manager Cemil Bey and the receptionists went out of their way to make us feel welcome throughout our stay. This small hotel is in an excellent location in Sultanahmet, with very tastefully decorated clean and cozy rooms, impeccable service and an open buffet breakfast that would put 5-star larger hotels in Istanbul to shame. We also very much enjoyed the hamam and restaurant recommendations of our receptionist friends which all turned out to be very good and reasonably priced compared to similar alternatives. A truly wonderful small boutique hotel that is unlikely to disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgief
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in November. The hotel was very clean and our room was very nice - not the largest of rooms, but big enough for what we needed. The hotel has recently been refurbished and was very well presented throughout. The staff are incredibly helpful, booking us taxis whenever we needed them and recommending places to eat and which hamam to go to etc. The hotel is in a great location only about five minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and within easy walking distance to most tourist attractions. The breakfast in the hotel is fantastic - far too much to be able to sample everything in one sitting!! The freshly made pastries and bread were a perfect start to the day. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Poulman
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Darussade over New Year's eve 2011. The hotel is in an excellent location in the old quarter, walking distance from all the main sights and with a very good choice of restaurants on the doorstep. The 24-hour mini market across the street is vary handy, too. Breakfast is buffet and it is very good, choice of homemade cookies, cheese borek, freashly made omelettes, etc. All the staff are very attentive and friendly and we really could not fault the service. The only drawback is the size of the standard rooms; they are very small. Unfortunately, this is a result of the building itself, which is a charming old wooden traditional Turkish house, so it can not be modified. The deluxe rooms are great, we were upgraded free of charge for two nights as it was free. Realistically, I should be giving this hotel five stars for the level of service, but unfortunately the size of the standard rooms does not justify this. However, I would not hesitate to go back to Darussaade.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with a fabulous home made breakfast”
Reviews.Author: blyth76
Reviews.Content: It is clear that the Darussaade Hotel has recently been done up, as the rooms are very stylised, to what I can only imagine is in Ottoman tradition. The rooms have everything you could require, with flat screen T.V, great shower, and comfy beds. The only thing missing would be the complimentary tea and coffee that you normally get. The location is fantastic. It is far enough away from the Blue Mosque to not be in the middle of all the hussle and bussle, but everything in the old town is within easy reach, with the Blue Mosque and restaurants only a five minute walk away. Don't get too excited about the Sauna that is mentioned as it looks like an empty office! The staff couldn't do enough to help, and gave us some great recommendations for food and entertainment, and the real star of the show is that every morning there is home made pastries, jams and Crepes - just delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, good location and fantastic hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: TraceyAshall
Reviews.Content: A very well priced hotel for the heart of where it's all at in Istanbul. We were a stone's throw away from the Blue Mosque, Arasta Bazaar, Tram (or Trolley if you are American!). My luggage did not arrive with me and the staff were so helpful in following up with the airport to ensure the delivery of it. In fact they even knew the transportation company who were delivering and got friends to go chase up with a driver in Taksim Square to find out why it was so late as it was due to arrive at around 7.30pm the evening after I arrived and didn't turn up til 2am the morning after. The rooms are small but comfortable. The weather was really cold so they had great central heating, the showers are really powerful which is great and breakfast was included in the meal and just to top it off they make fantastic homemade cookies! Good food, good location and fantastic hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Magreee
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel in the picturesque Sultanahmet , close to the Blue Mosque, is the ideal placeto visit this glorious city. We were near the main attractions (all the most beautiful Mosques, Haghia Sofia, the Basilica Cistern). It's perfect also to reach all then other parts of the city, since the tram stop to Beyoglu is very close, and Eminou (were you can take the ferry) is just 5 minutes of walk. The staff was the most kind and helpful we have ever met. The room was very nice, the bathroom was new with a big shower, the breakfast offers a lot of wonderful tipical cakes and also sausages, eggs and omelette, and we also enjoied the sauna.. .Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Darussaade home away from home..”
Reviews.Author: Rachel070770
Reviews.Content: A heartfelt thank you to all the staff at The Darussaade for making our trip to Istanbul a memorable, happy occassion. We were in Istanbul for a cousins wedding and we all stayed (14 of us) at The Darussaade. The staff could not do enough for us. The Darussaade was well situated in Sultanahmet. Close proximity to all historical sites such as Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar etc etc. Thank you "The Darussaade" We are missing you all Rachel, Deborah, Chantel, John, Helen.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: agplus
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I felt at home. You can tell from staff attitudes that you are a guest and not a customer (echo later by Jimmy the manager), they are friendly, full of local advise (this is required in the dog eat dog city) and can't do enough to help you. Location is perfect and 5 minutes walk from the blue mosque. The breakfast is magical, with home made pancakes, handmade cakes and jams, smiles from the staff and a far cry from other Istanbul Hotels I've stayed in (Best Western Eresin Taxim). I asked from a view from my room, and got a one, down side was this was a hot room on the top floor and the air conditioner wasn't great. This one niggle was completely outweighed by all the positives. I would stay here gain!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place for the perfect price”
Reviews.Author: aaannarbor
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, boutique hotel in the Old City, within walking distance from major attractions as well as easy access to the tram around the city, this is it. The owner, manager and desk service are truly superb, willing to help plan your day, call a taxi, wake you up, etc. The breakfasts are plentiful and American as well as Turkish food is served buffet style. Some of the pastries are homemade and wonderful. The rooms are not huge but comfortable and certainly roomy. We ate big lunches and walked all over the city, so we were happy to sit in the room with a loaf of bread, cheese and fruit in the evenings. You need to walk stairs but the desk staff will certainly carry your bags up.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ZannLewis
Reviews.Content: Darussaade Hotel, located in the heart of the Sultanahmet (old city of Istanbul) was a delightful find on my recent trip to Turkey (Oct 2010). Located within easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace with its Archeaological Museum, and the Underground Cistern, this hotel scores for me five stars in terms of location, service and quality of room decor and cleanliness. Mr Cemil Mazlumoglu the hotel manager and his staff, in particular Omar, spoiled this weary traveller during her stay at Darussaade. No question was too onerous for Mr Mazlumoglu who was a font of knowledge and extremely helpful during my stay. My room was luxurious and surprising given the hotel's central location, was also very quiet at night. Darussaade Hotel originally built in the 19th century is a protected example of Ottoman civil architecture, fully restored and with all the mod-cons a traveller could wish for. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough and if I would return to Turkey I would also be returning to the Darussaade.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mike1Paris
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel Excellent location Some rooms are small Sometimes noisy (close to many mosques and railroad) Professional staff

Reviews.Title: “ottoman charm”
Reviews.Author: Saundie
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. My husband and I spent 2 nights here in late September and wished we could have stayed longer. This is a gem, located in a quiet part of the old city which makes it very convenient to visit the main tourist sites. The hotel has retained all the charm of an ottoman mansion with all the mod cons. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival and the staff were very friendly throughout our stay. Would highly recommend staying here and would definitely stay here if we return.

Reviews.Title: “A solid average hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin0827
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Sultanahmed area of Istanbul which is the touristy, older part of Istanbul with all the attractions within 5-10 minute of easy walk. Because it is in touristy area, the streets are narrow, lot of cats and dogs around but not bothering people. The hotel is nice and pretty small. I think about 10 rooms. No elevator; so for your suitecases they do help you to take them up and down the stairs. The offer a complete, self service breakfast. In early morning, you will hear the islamic prayer which is broadcasted over speakers from near by mosques. That is the case in all Istanbul and not a big deal. You can smell the omlete and the cooking oil in the hallways in morning when they are preparing breakfast; so if you are smell sensitive, this maybe an issue. The rooms are small; not sure if that is the case in all Istanbul or not. They have free internet, free safe, free breakfast. They provided us free taxi pick up from airport but going back we paid for our taxi which was $20 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest, most helpful people working here”
Reviews.Author: fensterSeattle
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, breakfast outstanding and wonderful atmosphere. Room was small but otherwise it was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippers9
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! We spent 4 nights at this wonderful boutique hotel located in walking distance to many of the major sights in Istanbul. The stay could not do enough for you. We had a terrific room on the top floor (there are no elevators, but the staff will bring your luggage up and down the stairs for you). We had 6 windows in our room and we had a beautiful view of the the Bosporus. We could walk to many good restaurants. They served a good breakfast every morning. We would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean and close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Cisterns.”
Reviews.Author: lainielondon
Reviews.Content: Darussade Hotel was a delight. In a large city like Istanbul, it was wonderful to come back to our oasis of quiet. Located in a safe neighbourhood, it was close to many restaurants and small shops plus there was a little grocery store across the street. The hotel was very clean and beautifully appointed. The room was a nice size and had windows which could be opened at night. There was also an in-room safe, hairdryer and 3 piece bathroom including a toilet/bidet. The bed was a comfortable queen. The staff of the Darussaade were welcoming and very helpful. They provided umbrellas for the rainy days. The breakfast provided an excellent start to the day. Juices,coffees, teas, choices of egg dishes, homemade baking, various spreads, fruit, olives, tomatoes, cereals and several cheeses were on offer. I highly recommend the Darussaade.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay.”
Reviews.Author: juniemoonie
Reviews.Content: Omar and the manager, Cemi (forgive my spelling), responded to my every question and went beyond the call of duty to provide me information on, for example, public ferries, and tell me when a tour would be useful and what I could do on my own. I liked the location, out of the beaten path, but close to fabulous restaurants and all the major sites. Breakfast was lovely and my room was small but more than adequate to my needs. If you're a fancy lady, you might need something more upscale, but this hotel was a sheer delight for me

Reviews.Title: “Turkish treasure in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: smitjos
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its high position in trip advisor listings for istanbul and its value for money. It more than lived up to expectations. When my son and I arrived at the hotel late in the evening, we were greeted by first name. This was an indication of how helpful and attentive all the staff were throughout the stay. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were immaculate, with efficient air conditioning, and the most powerful shower I have had the pleasure to use. Breakfast was a real treat of fresh cooked pastries, omlettes and a delicious pancake presented to you every breakfast. I would recommend the hotel and hope to return in the future It most definitely deserves its high rating.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulNancy
Reviews.Content: The Darussaade Hotel is a gem! We stayed for six nights in this clean and comfortable small hotel situated in the Sultanahmet District right in the shadow of the Blue Mosque and many other local places of interest. The rooms are bright and well appointed, although the sit down shower was a bit of a challenge for a six foot tall person, other rooms just have showers. The breakfast buffet was a surprising delight being well stocked and varied. Don't forget to try one of the Turkish breakfast omelettes which are excellent and the coffee is good, though the Turkish style coffee is a little bit sludgy but certainly wakes you up. The staff are excellent, especially Omer and Cagatay (as well as Cemil (Hotel Manager)), who cheerfully dispense local knowledge and great recommendations for eating and I heartily recommend the Darussaade Hotel for its great location and friendly service. You could stay at one of the larger downtown hotels but you will miss out on this little piece of Turkish delight. Jason & Nancy Keenan

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality ,Great location.”
Reviews.Author: jrski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything a small hotel should aspire to be .The staff from the moment they greet you until they farewell you, make you feel welcome and go out of their way to ensure you are comfortable and happy. The hotel is spotlessly clean and tidy and our room on the top floor had a splendid view and all the necessary amenities including free wireless internet. are pleasant The breakfast buffet was beautifully prepared and offered a variety to suit every taste. Standards are high,staff are pleasant and helpful, and the hotel is very well situated in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in a most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: RobynChoi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to the Aya Sofia, Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Topaki Palace. It is just at the corner end of the restaurants/bars row in Sultanahmet. The front office managers both shifts night and day are most helpful and friendly! To go to most places outside Sultanahmet- just take the tram! And if dont miss DOORS, Umit Gunal's boutique for the funkiest clothes!

Reviews.Title: “My picky wife loves this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ronhon
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in total and we just loved it. We found the room cozy and super clean - no cigarette or old carpet smell. All staff are extremely customer oriented and provided very good shopping or eating tips. The store manager whom I have forgotten his name is caring and friendly. The location is also great. It is only minutes from most of the tourist spots. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Moved to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: NLK1001
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Darussaade at 7pm on Saturday night to be told there was a problem with the airconditioning and we were being moved to another hotel. While the replacement hotel was okay, it is never a good experience to have this happen (and the sceptic in you wonders!). Disappointing, because it looked great on the website.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TCYVirginia
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a boutique hotel in Istanbul which is reasonably priced, well-located, and provides superior service, look no further than the Darussade. We just spent 3 amazing nights at this lovely little hotel and can't wait to return. LOCATION is in Sultanahmet area about a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc. Lots of dining and shopping opportunities within easy walking distance. ROOMS are small, beautifully decorated and comfortable. Storage space is minimal. Bathrooms are small, but well-designed. No elevator, but the staff is always there to assist getting things upstairs. BREAKFAST is very good and the breakfast service is excellent. SERVICE is simply amazing. The attitude of every person on staff is cheerful and eager to please. The front desk staff has all the answers and provides them with a smile. Chamber maids and maintenance staff may not speak your language, but they make it clear that your satisfaction is their goal. I could mention several names, but there is one stand out. Omer has the best customer-service attitude I've ever encountered. No task is too great for him. He did everything for us from hauling our very heavy bags upstairs to arranging a great tour. His dining recommendations were excellent. His sense of humor was infectious. Just one problem --- Omer had one very bad day during our visit. That was the day after the USA defeated Turkey in the basketball World Championship final. He was so depressed that I was afraid he'd need therapy. I, of course, was very sympathetic and did nothing to remind him that WE WON!!! Seriously, my wife and I feel like a part of the Darussaade family. If you are looking for a resort with swimming pools on the waterfront, you should look elsewhere. But if you are looking for excellent accommodations and the best possible personalized service, the Darussade is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with top quality service”
Reviews.Author: TrentCW
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really a wonderful find. I stayed in three of the rooms (I was here multiple times), including the single, the deluxe, and the really comfortable suite. The rooms are well done, with good amenities, and a very comfortable feel. Breakfast was top-notch -- a good buffet, plus fresh egg-dishes and crepes upon request. What really sets this hotel apart though is their service, and they know it. They're incredibly friendly and helpful. The think nothing of sitting down with you for 20 minutes to help plan a day, or even a week. They're knowledgeable and will call to make reservations, get a cab, check on events, etc. Cagatay (sorry for the mispelling) was particularly helpful. When I came in without a reservation after a failed attempt to find another hotel, he set me up in a great room at a great price. Top-notch -- it made me feel very welcome. If you're looking for a place in the old town and are new to Istanbul, I don't see you doing much better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraAK
Reviews.Content: A charming and well located small Hotel with very friendly and accommodating staff. The rooms were a touch on the small side - even the deluxe room - but nevertheless clean and comfortable. Does it matter when you are not in it for most of the time? A fabulous, well presented breakfast was on offer and that extra pancake was a delightful surprise. The Hotel is well placed - 5 mins to the Blue Mosque in one direction and 5 mins to the waterfront in the other. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gloria S
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say about this boutique hotel is the staff, they couldn't have been more friendly and helpful from organising a day trip to posting my postcards. We arrived very early in the morning and our room wasn't ready so we were offered another room to sleep and freshen up until our room was done. Where else do you get that service with a friendly smile and made to feel it was no effort. We were picked up from the airport complimentary at 6.30am. We had a deluxe room so will make comments about this room. It was nicely decorated and very clean. We did hear prayer time early each morning but that did not bother us. I don't know if this happens all the time or only at Ramadan. Our room was at the front of the hotel, generally it was very quiet. I guess the only addition I would make to the room was perhaps a box of tissues. The bathroom was very functional, clean and nicely decorated. I would perhaps have liked the hot water a bit hotter, but as the weather was warm it wasn't a problem. The location is excellent close to all the main tourist attractions. There are no tea & coffee facilities in the room but staff will bring you one whenever you ask. We were also offered tea when in reception one morning. Breakfast was very good, good range of food and again the staff were so polite and helpful. We loved our 5 days in Istanbul and would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, very clean rooms, very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Andy035
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Sultanahmet, near to sights but still quiet enough in a side street. Try for Room 303 on top floor, with views from windows in three directions. Free wifi, a/c, walkable distance from Sultanahmet Tram stop, if you're coming from the airport by very easy public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Service”
Reviews.Author: somewhereinoldeurope
Reviews.Content: Rated as a four star and it really is a four star. The hotel is tastefully appointed and a classy turn of the century old building with only about 12 rooms. The hotel is solid, clean, and surprisingly spacious. The location is very good - at the quiet end of a popular street with lots of bars and restaurants. The real advantage of staying here was the excellent service. The guys that run this place are friendly and very attentive. They helped me with directions, real advice, and getting a cab for my return home. They even packed a breakfast for me. The hotel is spotlessly clean and everything works perfectly, there are no corners cut here. The water pressure in my room was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “it's really a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaniY
Reviews.Content: great location which near to almost everything you may need, excellent room service, room is clean and elegant although it's small, delicious and variable breakfast and above all very helpful and kind working staff. i'd like to go there again and stay more

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness - Check, Staff - Check, Loacation - Check, Memorable check, Best Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Mampillys
Reviews.Content: My wife and i were in Istanbul for 4 nights and 5 days, we had a wonderful time. People in Istanbul are nice, but the nicest people are in Darussaade hotel :-) I would 1000% recommend this hotel: Facts:- Location:- - Centrally located, easy access (walkable) to all famous sites like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace etc please refer to the website.You could finish visiting these places in the first one or 2 days as its very near.Nice place to walk around small alleys and small shops, please dont forget to Bargain :-D - Easy access to all other parts of the city like Taksim square, Egyptian bazaar famous Malls Cevahir(#1 in Europe) & Forum all within 20 to 25 min by taxi (the easy way) this will cost you not more than 20 TL. Cheaper will be tram, there is a tram station in sultanahmet square walkable distance (i would say 200m or less) its close to the Blue Mosque. - Easy access nice genuine Turkish food a bit expensive since its the touristic part of the city :-) try the kebap in Deverish restaurant oppo to Blue Mosque, nice food and also you can enjoy the Sufi show. Other good restaurants, please ask the best staffs in the world Ã–mer and Cemil :-) their recommendations never disappointed us. - You should definitely try the cruise, i would recommend cruise at night, they have pick up and drop facility. Check with Ã–mer ;-) Hotel:- - Awesome breakfast !!! Especially the apple cookie :-D, all in house baked cookies and bread, please try the Cay and Turisk coffee - The room we stayed in was opulent! very clean, the bed was comfortable and the room service was beyond expectation, excellent !! - Friendly, most helpful and excellent staff, they always have a smile on their face 24x7, i would like to thank - Ã–mer, for making our stay enjoyable,easy and memorable. "Thank you Ã–mer ! you are amazing, you have been more than helpful and thanks for all the tips and suggestions, they were all good, you are the star of the Hotel" - Cemil, for giving us all the excellent shops and spots of the genuine Turkish restaurants and the best of the best shops in Istanbul for Turkish coffee, confectioneries, etc. "Thank you Cemil, thank you for everything, you are the most down-to-earth and humble person we have ever met" - Turan/Soner, Thank you for preparing the best breakfast in Istanbul :-) - Cagatay, Thank you for helping us during our departure, you were extremely professional and very friendly. Keep up the good work !! Places to shop:- - Cevahir Mall (#1 in Europe) this place is huge (Taxi will cost you 20 TL not more) - Forum, its like any other shopping mall in Europe but nice (Taxi will cost you 20 TL not more) - Grand Bazaar, i would give this less priority, since its for Tourist ;-) you need to get your bargaining skills right here ;-) but its worth seeing this place - Arasta Bazaar, smaller than Grand Bazaar, but for souvenirs and other local stuff. - Egyptian Bazaar, amazing :-) you will see all kind of spices, you could buy the natural apple tea as well - HacI Bekir,its pronounced as Ha-jje be-kkir, the best in Turkey for all the Turkish delight. its close to Egyptian Bazaar, walk along side of the new Mosque you see next to Egyptian bazaar 100m you will find it on the right. Once again we had a great time in Istanbul apart from the 35Â°c + heat :-D but since the hotel was near, we could always drop-by wherever we felt exhausted. Overall a very nice hotel with a great value for money and the services and staff will make your stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hotel with Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelingNow
Reviews.Content: Darussaade is perfectly located in the Sultanhamet neighborhood - close to the major tourist sites of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and Topkapi Palace - but on a quiet stretch of the street. The staff was quite helpful. When we checked out, the staff member who helped us made a mistake in the rate that they charged us, but the hotel proactively emailed us the next day to let us know about the mistake and resolved it without us ever complaining or bringing it to their attention.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and location!!”
Reviews.Author: cervantess
Reviews.Content: We have just came back from our two weeks journey to Turkey. The staff of this hotel made everything easy for us, they have arranged the tours and tickets to Capaddocia and Ephesus, and they were always ready to answer our endless questions! The location of the hotel is great, just a few minutes walkaway to the main attractions.The homemade breakfast was really delicious. The room was well decorated, clean and very comfortable. I can strongly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Staying this hotel leaves only good mamories”
Reviews.Author: Nataly15
Reviews.Content: Darussaade has really good, comfortable atmosphere and good location. Me and my sister were staying there one month ago and it was extremely hot weather. Fortunately, air condition in the room was working perfectly, it helped a lot. We had the big suit room in the first flour, connected with work room, number 101. We liked decoration of the room. Also we were surprised in a good way with their breakfasts. It must be admitted that staff was really friendly and polite. I remember Omer and Cemil. Omer has good sense of humor and I am missing his jokes even now. Thanks them for being so nice and pleasant. They recommended lots of nice place to see, so our trip turned from 4 day to 7 days. This hotel is worth to spend time there!!!

Reviews.Title: “an amazing boutique hotel with great hospitality and great location”
Reviews.Author: vikramIndia
Reviews.Content: our 3 nights stay at the hotel was very comfortable..atilla and and all the other people thr took special care of all our needs and even guided us for all little things we wanted to know abt istanbul...the rooms are a little small but amazingly clean and well kept......it was worth every penny....the breakfast was also sumptous and the manager is also very frirendly.........the trip advisor comments finally helped us find a good hotel in istanbul within our budget

Reviews.Title: “This place is just lovely”
Reviews.Author: chappardababbar
Reviews.Content: Great staff, really lovely rooms, great breakfast, excellent service. Clean. Perfect location. Wifi Recommended to all without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Last Minute Find!”
Reviews.Author: traveliz
Reviews.Content: Our plans changed suddenly and we needed a hotel for one night in Istanbul. This turned out to be the perfect choice! Our welcome was very friendly, the room small but lovely and spotlessly clean, great shower, great firm bed, comfortable all the way around!
