The hotel is in easy walking distance to all the big sights but out of the way enough to be very quiet at night; (A bit easy to get lost too) Breakfast was suburb and huge! This was a great find! I also strongly recommend Aloran restaurant nearby (close to the Four Seasons) for the best food I've had in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: mullaboy
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but very clean. Quiet ( except for the call to prayer). Beds firm but comfortable. Nice staff. Very good breakfast. Very good location. Close to all the Sultanamet points of interest. (Dont miss the old Hagia Sofia smaller and older than the famous one and a 5 minute walk down the hill.) In an area with many shops and good restaurants, many with roof terraces.

Reviews.Title: “Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia just 5-6 mins walk from Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: ashmama
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in Istanbul at Darussaade Hotel. Firstly the Hotel is as exactly described so do not be disappointed that the rooms are small, but they are clean, practical and beautifully decorated. We were treated to a free room upgrade to one of the best rooms as we were celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary! Location is in quite part of Sultanahmet, perfect as just 5-6 min walk from the Hotel, across the Araasta bazaar and you are onto Sultanahmet square. Blue mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace all within walking distance and clear signs everywhere. Staff were very helpful with directions, recommendations for restaurants etc. a big Thank you esp to Atilla for doing your best to look after us.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lepmay
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this charming B&B type hotel, the Darussaade, I knew that I had chosen a winner. The facade was beautiful and inviting. The staff was warm and friendly. The location couldn't have been better, being at the quiet end of the main street in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. We were just steps away from a mini-market, many restaurants and shops, a short walking distance to the main attractions and to the tram. Being at the quiet end of this area, we enjoyed good night's sleeps for our entire 6 night stay. Our room was one of the smaller ones, but had a grear view of the Bosphorus and had a fridge, safe, and wardrobe and a well appointed bath. It was immaculate. Breakfast was a lovely meal with traditional items served buffet -style, and eggs cooked to order. The staff really sets the Darussaade apart. They were well chosen for their command of languages, personality, knowledge and love of Istanbul, and how to get around. Their recommendations seemed to be just what we were looking for, ( a great restaurant where the Istanbuli's dine, an adventure at a Turkish Bath, some off the tourist trail excursions. They also provided us with insights into the Turkish people and a game or two of backgammon,(a national pastime,).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay - would go again”
Reviews.Author: NorthYorksHistoryMan
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Darussaade in a de-luxe room. This was good size with en-suite off the lobby entrance to the room. It overlooked the road outside but there is not much traffic and it was generally quiet. We did not hear any noise from other guests. The call to prayer from the Blue Mosque is quite loud but you get used to it. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast is comprehensive and includes a choice of omelettes. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms but reception will provide drinks for you. We would go again

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wished for and more...”
Reviews.Author: drsunilk
Reviews.Content: In short: I booked Darussade after reading the good reviews in tripadvisor via hotels.com and stayed there with my wife for 3 nights.I don't regret my decision as i really enjoyed my stay there. Good: 1)The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and never said 'no,its not possible" to any of the requests.They responded promptly for room services,arranged taxi's for travel and even packed a delicious breakfast for us at 5 AM when we left one day very early for ephesus trip although the breakfast starts at 7.30 AM.They were also extremely helpful in giving suggestions regarding restaurants,places to shop,massage etc. 2)Warm & hassle free check in with a welcome drink.They have 24 Hrs check in with non-sleepy and alert staff round the clock.You don't have to ring a bell and spend minutes waiting for a sleepy staff to come even at odd hours. 3)Cozy, comfortable & clean room:We stayed in room 101 which is a deluxe double room with a bed room and a well appointed living room.The rooms were a bit small but adequate.But most of the hotels in istanbul are converted old houses and you wont get the feeling of warmth there in new hotels with bigger rooms.The room was immaculately clean and the staff made it a point to keep them clean at all times,even going to the extend of cleaning them twice daily! The bed was super soft contrary to few reviews here and the sheets,pillows and blanket were spotless and dust free.The bathroom was also spotless,with plenty of fresh towels,toiletries which included even a sewing kit and hair drier.The central AC was noiseless and worked perfectly to keep us comfortable.We really appreciated the free wifi (the password was kept ready in a printed sheet in the room), minibar with a variety of drinks & chocolate,programmable safe,lots and lots of storage spaces,cloth sandals to walk on wooden floor and the large office desk. 4)Stupendous breakfast with a buffet menu which surprised me with the variety of delicious items available.Even the items which were not there were prepared and served on request.I particularly liked the fresh baked breads,home made cakes,cookies and the cheese.The perfect way to start the day. 5)Location:The hotel is just a few minutes of walking distance away from major attractions as already mentioned here and so don't go for arranged city tours(the mistake i did) if you are staying here. Bad: Nothing major.The only problem we had on the first day was noise from the room above at night,like they were shifting or rearranging some furniture.But the next two nights were quiet and there was no noise from outside too. Tips: 1)Keep a travel adapter for electrical points to recharge your mobile and camera as all outlets are circular. 2)Book a room on top floor if you want a good outside view as the ground floor room view is restricted to the road outside. 3)There is a similar sounding hotel nearby so keep the address ready for taxi driver.Pronounce the hotel as "daa-ru-saa-dey" to make it clear for the turkish driver. 4)Always request taxi service via the hotel staff as this place is famous for taxi scams. 5)Keep extra time for traveling around as the traffic jams can get really nasty.Some areas are suddenly closed for traffic. 6)Make your international calls from hotel phone(they have direct call facility) as the roaming charges may be many times higher. 7)Keep an umbrella handy for rain,sunscreen lotion and sunglasses for day trips like ephesus tour,mineral water for drinking as i had to pay once 1 $ for a small water bottle at one location. 8)The roads are pretty small and always watch for traffic before crossing them. 9)The domestic flights can get delayed suddenly so plan accordingly.Our flight from izimir to istanbul got delayed and the entire evening was spent inside the airport. 10)Don't carry tripods if you are not a professional photographer as many places charge extra for entry or don't allow them at all. 11)Most sites have audio aids as a self help tour guide.Each point of interest will be marked with a number and pressing the number will give you description about the site.don't forget to look for them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kumicoul
Reviews.Content: For our brief stay in Istanbul, I wanted something that was traditional, rather than a characterless hotel, The darussade was a perfect find. The area is fantastic close to the main sites, with restaurants and shops just round the corner. The small, but beautifully appointed rooms were all decorated differently. We had booked a standard room and for the first night we had a room that disappointingly overlooked a wall, but they voluntarily upgraded us to a de luxe room on the top floor with sea views for the rest of our stay. The breakfast was outstanding - cereals, yogurts, local cheeses, fresh fruit salad and omelettes, but best of all wonderful home baked cakes and biscuits. The staff, without exception were courteous and friendly. They were only too willing to recommend restaurants, arrange transfers and even accompanied us to the police station when my husband had his wallet stolen on the tram. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is well situated, but we have never had such hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: 255100Richard
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was awesome - the hotel new and well situated, the beakfasts teriffic - but it was really badly let down by the hradest beds we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “everything we were hoping it would be”
Reviews.Author: ddunnam
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for seeing the main attractions. All were within walking distance or a short tram ride. Rooms a little small, but very clean. Friendly staff was extremely helpful. Breakfast was great. Wonderful selection of restaurants nearby.Would definitely stay there again ourselves and would recommend to anyone planning to go it on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Roz08
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in this very interesting city, with very friendly people. The hotel was in a great location. The rooms were small as already commented on trip advisor but perfectly adequate. They were very clean and furnished very well and the service was very helpful and friendly. The area of Sultanahmet was an excellent base with a bazaar, the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and great restaurants, all a few minutes walk away. We had excellent food at Khorasani (39 Ticarethane Sokak, a lane off Divan Yolu) and Amedros (Hoca Rustern, off Divan Yolu). Lots of restaurants in this area! I am vegetarian and found the food excellent! We wanted to visit the Suleymaniye Mosque but were disappointed to find out when we got there that it was being renovated and therefore closed! This just means we will have to return - and I hope this will be very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: deeply_troubled
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The room was very small, and not at all what I would expect for 4 star but it was very clean and well furnished. Breakfast was very good. Staff were efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: scotvic
Reviews.Content: Just as everyone else has said, this renovated traditional Ottoman house is a hotel of real quality, from the friendly and attentive staff, to the beautifully decorated rooms, and the home made cakes for breakfast. The rooms are not huge, but very pleasant and comfortable. We did not try the sauna. The breakfast buffet is really nice, first class coffee! Reception is manned 24 hours and there is 24 hour room service. The staff speak good English. The location is fantastic, only a few minutes on foot from the Blue Mosque and nearby bazaar and cafes etc. yet in a street that is silent at night, for excellent and restful sleep. Hagia Sofiya, Topkapui Place etc. only 5-10 minutes walk in theother direction and you can also easily get to the main tram line and find you way all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “we are the happy family”
Reviews.Author: sunnymiami
Reviews.Content: my family and i were in Istanbul in March and stayed at the Darussaade. our stay was so pleasant. the staff and owner were there to greet us everyday. the service and attention were outstanding. when we left we were all teary eyed but we are soon to return some day. they called us the happy family and it showed because we were happy as can be.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy small hotel just few steps from the main attractions!”
Reviews.Author: Andrey_Levchenko
Reviews.Content: We spent a great vacations in this hotel located in the heart of Istanbul. It takes you only 3-5 minutes to get main attractions (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and other) and 10-20 minutes to get any historical part of the city. Hotel is rather small with small (dont believe pictures, rooms are rather small =) but very comfortable rooms. There are several very nice restaurants in the area. Breakfast in the hotel is very good (especially if you order additionally one of the best turkish coffee in Istambul and fresh orange juice). I would recomend this hotel to everyone who do not want to see crowds of people everymorning (espesially comparing to Taksim district) and from other side to be in the center of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, charming, valuable, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: horesbaixes
Reviews.Content: Excellent standard, good value for money, one of the best places to stay in Istanbul. Five minutes walking from Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque, close to bars and restaurants, yet in a very silent area, so you can rest at night. The hotel is brand new, in a charming old wooden house, with wooden floor, Ottoman style decorated. Comfortable and clean room, double glass windows, good heating system, bathroom with nice thick towels, good pillows, good quality soap, slippers, laundry bag, television, telephone, fridge, safety box, internet wire fire, breakfast with home made products. The staff is more than outstanding, highly professional, welcoming, helpful over the call of duty, and extremely polite and respectful. They really make your stay easy in the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel. central location. outstanding service. fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: PMALAY
Reviews.Content: boutique hotel - the staff were absolutely fantastic. we were here for an anniversary trip and they arranged a free room upgrade plus a surprise bottle of wine with a note "happy anniversary". Rooms - super cute and quaint, wallpaper, wooden furniture, wooden floors. rooms had a quaint european feel to them. large bed was very comfortable, sheets were sparkling clean as was the room. bathroom size was fine, it was super modern and clean. our room on the 3rd floor had an ocean view. Service - one word: outstanding. They did not just meet expectations, they exceeded expectations. staff were extremely welcoming, hospitable and more than competent. we really liked that staff were also proactive, they often volunteered suggestion like "can we call you a taxi", "can we serve you breakfast in bed for free tmrw morning", etc. staff were also very helpful with info about istanbul and getting around - it was our first time so this was super helpful. Location - in Sultanhamet, literally a 2 min walk to Blue Mosque. From there, Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar, National Archealogical Museum are all a further couple minutes walk. Nice area with lots of restaurants. IMPORTANT TIP: taxi drivers in istanbul are absolute thieves. they have a trick where they can change the reading on the meter. we stopped at our destination and the meter jumped from 20 liras to 34 liras. HOWEVER, hotels and restaurants are happy to CALL a taxi for you from "safe stations". Do yourself a favour and call taxis to pick you up, these guys won't cheat you and it doesnt cost any extra.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy boutique hotel with wonderful staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea1978
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this place to anyone. The staff was always warm and helpful, the hotel is beautiful. Our room was small but very well-decorated with care taken to every detail. The room and hotel were clean. The breakfast was similar daily like some of the other reviews said, but we stayed for 6 days and enjoyed it everyday. Just ask for fresh orange juice and they'll make it quickly for you. Excellent location, a bit out of the main fray but so close to all of the main sites- we walked to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the Basillica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, the Grand and Spice Bazaars. Be sure to check out the photo album in the lobby of the original structure in 1997. You'll be amazed at the rehab quality!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ajdveni
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and in easy walking distance of the major sights. Lots of restaurants of all types close to the hotel. Our room on the top floor was lovely, although my son's single room was quite small. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful; they even provided a bottle of wine when they discovered it was my wife's birthday. We would definitely go there again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Debbbb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and near all the places that everyone must see in this city! Hotel staff has warmly welcomed us and helped us any way they could. Breakfast was delicious. I recommend this hotel to everyone from seniors to families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Sultanhamet -- highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: kramerkramerkramer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a quick weekend visit with a friend and we were extremely pleased with the location, price, and service from this hotel. The only minor quibble I had is that we requested two beds and the room was equipped with one queen bed and one rollaway which severely limited movement in the room. Other than that (and one little other quibble, below), this place was pretty much perfect. Great bathroom, shower, clean towels; good bed, clean sheets; and central and quiet location (except, of course, for the call to prayer early in the morning but that's to be expected anywhere in Istanbul) with a wonderful breakfast. You can get to any of the main tourist destinations -- which were the focus of this trip -- with a quick walk. We did get dinner recommendations for both nights -- one which was a success and one which was a dismal failure (Kalamar restaurant) -- but that didn't necessarily detract from the appreciation of the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Darussaade Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik Cad. No:96, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
